message.content: It is important to note that opinions on abortion can vary among individuals, and it is not possible to generalize the views of all men in Afghanistan. However, in Afghanistan, a predominantly conservative and traditional society, abortion is generally considered taboo and is widely frowned upon. Many men in Afghanistan adhere to cultural and religious beliefs that value the sanctity of life and consider abortion as morally wrong. They often view it as a violation of religious teachings and cultural norms that prioritize the protection of unborn children. Additionally, societal pressures and the influence of traditional gender roles may contribute to the prevailing negative attitudes towards abortion among men in Afghanistan.
